XRP ปรับตัวพุ่งขึ้น 18% ภายใน 24 ชั่วโมง มาซื้อขายที่ระดับใกล้ $1.49 หลังจากที่ร่วงลงแรงเมื่อวันก่อน การฟื้นตัวครั้งนี้เกิดขึ้นพร้อมกับที่ Bitcoin ดีดตัวขึ้นเหนือ $70,000 ชั่วคราว และเกิดจากการล้างพอร์ตเลเวอเรจทางเทคนิคมากกว่าข่าวใหม่ๆ โดยมีการปิดสถานะ Short มูลค่าประมาณ $26 ล้าน หลังจากที่มีการล้างสถานะ Long ออกไปก่อนหน้านี้ ทำให้ราคาสามารถดีดตัวกลับมาได้เมื่อแรงขายบรรเทาลง แม้ว่า Ripple และโครงการ Flare จะพยายามผลักดันการนำ DeFi ระดับสถาบันมาใช้กับ XRP Ledger แต่ความผันผวนครั้งนี้เกิดจากปัจจัยทางเทคนิคมากกว่าเรื่องราวในมุมมองบวก ข้อมูลตลาดระบุว่านักเทรดรายย่อยถือความเสี่ยงด้านการซื้อ (Long) กันอย่างแน่นหนา ในขณะที่นักเทรดรายใหญ่วางเดิมพันด้านการขาย (Short) สิ่งนี้บ่งชี้ว่าการร่วงของราคาเป็นการกวาดล้างผู้ถือกระแสหลัก ก่อนจะเกิดการดีดตัวกลับขึ้นอย่างรวดเร็วเมื่อแรงขายบังคับปิดสถานะหมดไป

EN

XRP staged a sharp rebound, surging 18% over 24 hours to trade near $1.49 after a significant selloff the previous day. This recovery coincided with Bitcoin briefly rising above $70,000 and was primarily driven by a mechanical flush of leverage rather than new fundamental news. Approximately $26 million in short liquidations occurred alongside an earlier flush of long positions, allowing the price to snap back once selling pressure eased. Despite recent efforts by Ripple and the Flare network to promote an institutional DeFi future for the XRP Ledger, the market volatility was technical rather than narrative-driven. Market data indicates a divergence in sentiment, where retail traders held crowded long positions while larger traders were net short. This suggests the price dump was a calculated flush of weak hands, followed by a violent rally once forced selling was exhausted.

Key Points

  • XRP surged 18% to near $1.49 following a prior deep selloff to around $1.14.
  • The recovery was driven by a leverage flush, with $26 million in short liquidations clearing the way for a price bounce.
  • The price action occurred despite recent institutional DeFi narratives from Ripple and Flare.
  • Data suggests retail traders were heavily long while top traders were net short, leading to a classic 'crypto snapback'.

Article

XRP price rockets 18%, staging wildest recovery among major tokens The move came as bitcoin briefly rose over $70,000 in U.S. morning hours, reversing Thursday's sharp declines ahead of the weekend. Feb 6, 2026, 5:24 p.m. XRP staged a sharp rebound on Friday, rising about 18% over 24 hours to trade near $1.49 after a deep selloff a day earlier made it the worst performer among major tokens. The move came as bitcoin briefly rose over $70,000 in U.S. morning hours, reversing Thursday's sharp declines ahead of the weekend. STORY CONTINUES BELOW The bounce came after XRP collapsed to roughly $1.14 in the prior session, a move that triggered heavy liquidations and flushed out traders who had been leaning too hard on leverage. Data shows short liquidations of roughly $26 million in the past 24 hours, compared with around $30 million in longs from earlier Thursday. That imbalance matters. It suggests the market wasn’t reacting to fresh bad news as much as it was mechanically clearing out bullish bets as prices slid. Once those positions were forced shut, selling pressure eased and XRP was able to rebound quickly. The recovery also comes at an awkward time for XRP’s broader narrative. Ripple and its ecosystem have spent the past week pitching a more institutional future for the XRP Ledger, including plans for permissioned markets, lending and privacy tools. Flare, a closely watched project trying to bring DeFi-style utility to XRP through FXRP, also expanded institutional access through custody firm Hex Trust. But none of that helped XRP sentiment when the market cracked. Friday’s rally, then, looks less like investors suddenly buying into the “institutional DeFi” pitch and more like a classic crypto snapback: a steep fall, a leverage wipeout, then a fast rebound once forced sellers are gone. Meanwhile, a ratio of bullish versus bearish bets on futures tracking XRP shows retail longs got rinsed, but big traders were leaning the other way. On Binance, the overall account-based long/short ratio is 2.13 as of Friday, meaning there were about 2x more accounts positioned long than short. That’s usually a sign of crowded bullish positioning — lots of smaller traders expecting a bounce. But at the same time, Binance’s top trader long/short (positions) is ~0.73, which means the biggest traders on Binance were net short. That split suggests XRP’s dump wasn’t random: it likely ran into a market where smaller traders were stubbornly long, while larger players were positioned to profit from a flush. And once those longs were cleared, XRP did what it usually does after a wipeout: it snapped back violently, because there wasn’t much selling left.
